intro: Baliospermum calycinum var. siamense, commonly known as the Siam bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
